program.name: HomeBridge
program.description:
HomeBridge helps first-time homebuyers in Cambridge purchase a home with city assistance covering a large portion of the purchase price.

To qualify, you must:
- Be a first-time homebuyer
- Have household income between 60% and 120% of Area Median Income (AMI)
- Be a current Cambridge resident OR have at least one adult household member who works full-time in Cambridge
- Complete a CHAPA-certified first-time homebuyer class
- Obtain a conventional, fixed-rate mortgage that meets City affordability rules (monthly housing costs between 25% and 33% of gross monthly income)
- Have sufficient assets for down payment and closing costs, and contribute any liquid assets above $40,000 to the purchase (higher threshold for households where all adults are 62+)

City assistance can cover up to 50%, 60%, or 65% of the purchase price depending on the number of bedrooms, subject to program rules and price limits.

Note: Funds and eligible homes are limited. Buyers must follow City restrictions and resale rules. Approval typically takes about 1 month after application.
program.website_description: First-time homebuyer assistance covering up to 50-65% of purchase price

warning_message.message: Funds and eligible homes are limited. Buyers must follow City restrictions and resale rules.

documents.text: Proof of income (tax returns, pay stubs, W-2, 1099, etc.)
Proof of assets (bank statements, investment accounts)
Proof of Cambridge residency (lease, utility bill) OR proof of full-time Cambridge employment
Proof of identity (ex: driver's license, official state ID card)
